block.p: Jessica Lynn Clark, a daughter of Carole S. Clark of New York and the late Paul Clark, was married yesterday to Henry Seiji Newman, the son of Seiko Newman and Dr. Robert G. Newman of Manhattan. Rabbi Charles D. Lippman officiated at the summer home of the bridegroom's parents in Sherman, Conn.

Mrs. Newman, 30, is a medical student at Yale. She graduated from Hamilton College and received a master's degree in public health from Columbia. Her father owned Redbird, a former jewelry store in Manhattan. Her mother is a fund-raising consultant at Rich Associates, an events management company in Manhattan.

Jessica Lynn Clark, a daughter of Carole S. Clark of New York and the late Paul Clark, was married yesterday to Henry Seiji Newman, the son of Seiko Newman and Dr. Robert G. Newman of Manhattan. Rabbi Charles D. Lippman officiated at the summer home of the bridegroom's parents in Sherman, Conn.

Mrs. Newman, 30, is a medical student at Yale. She graduated from Hamilton College and received a master's degree in public health from Columbia. Her father owned Redbird, a former jewelry store in Manhattan. Her mother is a fund-raising consultant at Rich Associates, an events management company in Manhattan.

Mr. Newman, also 30, is known as Seiji. The bridegroom is on leave as an associate at Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison, the Manhattan law firm. This month, he is to become a clerk to Judge Denny Chin of the Federal District Court in Manhattan. He graduated from Pace University and Fordham University Law School. His father is the president of Continuum Health Partners, a Manhattan health-care consortium, which includes Beth Israel Medical Center and St. Luke's-Roosevelt Hospital Center.
